Description: THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE AND RADIATION MONITORING DEVICES, INC  WILL COLLABORATE THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT TO DEVELOP NEW SOLID STATE RADIATION DETECTION TECHNOLOGY   WE WILL IDENTIFY AND DEVELOP A LOW COST, SCALABLE, AND ROBUST POLYCRYSTALLINE BASED SEMICONDUCTOR WITH HIGH RADIATION DETECTION EFFICIENCY TO EQUIP THE NEXT GENERATION OF COMPACT, ENERGY EFFICIENT AND LOW COST PORTABLE RADIATION DETECTORS  IN THIS MULTIDISCIPLINARY STUDENT ORIENTED PROJECT, WE WILL USE MATHEMATICAL ALGORITHMS TO IDENTIFY NEXT GENERATION COMPOUNDS WITH THE PHYSICAL AND SEMICONDUCTING PROPERTIES REQUIRED BY THE CWMD MISSION INCLUDING STABLE ELEVATED TEMPERATURE OPERATION, HIGH RADIATION DETECTION SENSITIVITY, AND ABLE TO SURVIVE HARSH RADIATION ENVIRONMENTS   WE WILL DEVELOP NEW TECHNIQUES FOR EFFICIENTLY MANUFACTURING NOVEL MATERIALS, AND DESIGN, ASSEMBLE, AND TEST PROTOTYPES THAT WILL ULTIMATELY LEAD TO PRACTICAL DEVICES   IN ADDITION TO THE PRACTICAL OUTCOMES, THE PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE BASE OF NEW MATERIALS FOR RADIATION DETECTION NEW LOW COST POLYCRYSTALLINE DETECTOR MATERIALS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO REPLACE THE CURRENT TECHNOLOGY OF EXPENSIVE SINGLE CRYSTALS THAT MUST BE SLOWLY GROWN FROM ULTRA PURE STARTING MATERIALS   UNLIKE THE CURRENTLY AVAILABLE TECHNOLOGY, OUR NEW MATERIALS WILL NOT REQUIRE COMPLEX AND EXPENSIVE COOLING FOR OPERATION IN HIGH TEMPERATURE ENVIRONMENTS   ADDITIONALLY, THEIR UNIQUE CHEMICAL COMPOSITION WILL ENABLE STABLE OPERATION OVER LONG TIME PERIODS   THEIR COMBINATION OF HIGH TEMPERATURE OPERATION, LOW COST, HIGH DETECTION EFFICIENCY, AND SCALABLE MANUFACTURING WILL SUPPORT WIDESPREAD IMPLEMENTATION OF RADIATION DETECTION DEVICES AND THEREBY STRONGLY SUPPORT THE CWMD MISSION TO PROTECT THE HOMELAND FROM RADIOLOGICAL AND NUCLEAR THREATS   THE FOCUS ON STUDENT ENGAGEMENT WITH PRIVATE INDUSTRY WILL HELP CREATE A NEW TALENTED GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS NEEDED TO ADVANCE THE FIELD OF RADIATION DETECTION AND NUCLEAR SECURITY

NOVEL LOW COST, ROBUST AND HIGH SENSITIVITY POLYCRYSTALLINE RADIATION DETECTORSABSTRACT  WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP POLYCRYSTALLINE ION CONDUCTING SOLID ELECTROLYTES FOR THE PURPOSE OF RADIATION DETECTION  WHILE THIS INITIAL CHOICE MAY SEEM COUNTERINTUITIVE, CONSIDERING THE LARGE EFFECTIVE MASSES OF IONS COMPARED TO ELECTRONS, AND THE VERY HIGH CONCENTRATIONS OF POINT DEFECTS THAT COULD CAPTURE PHOTOGENERATED CHARGES, WE AIM TO DEMONSTRATE THAT IT IS POSSIBLE TO OBTAIN HIGH SENSITIVITY RESPONSE WITH ABOVE BAND GAP IRRADIATION AND THEREBY ENABLE THE DESIGN OF INEXPENSIVE, SENSITIVE, ROBUST, AND SCALABLE RADIATION DETECTORS  ALONGSIDE DEMONSTRATING PROOF OF TECHNOLOGICAL VIABILITY FOR THIS NEW TECHNOLOGY, OUR PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL AIM TO DEVELOP MATERIAL SELECTION AND MANUFACTURING GUIDELINES THAT WILL ACT AS A FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE APPLICATIONS, LEVERAGING POLYCRYSTALLINE IONIC SOLID STATE CONDUCTORS AS RADIATION DETECTORS  THIS ALLOWS FOR THE EXPLORATION OF NOVEL SENSING MECHANISMS IN POLYCRYSTALLINE MATERIALS WITH UNIQUE OPPORTUNITIES IN TERMS OF HIGH SENSITIVITY, COUPLED WITH EXTENDED DEVICE STABILITY EVEN UNDER HARSH ENVIRONMENTS  ELEVATED TEMPERATURE, HIGH RADIATION INTENSITIES DOSES, HIGH PRESSURE, AND CHEMICALLY AGGRESSIVE ENVIRONMENTS  WHILE ALLOWING FOR EASE OF FABRICATION, LOW COST, NON TOXICITY, LOW NOISE  LARGE BAND GAP , AND RAPID RESPONSE  THE ANTICIPATED IMPACT OF THIS STUDY WILL LEAD TO DEVELOPMENT OF NEW MATERIALS THAT CAN RESULT IN COMPACT AND LOW COST SOLID STATE DETECTOR DEVICES WITH HIGH SELECTIVITY AND SENSITIVITY RESPONSE IN OPEN ENVIRONMENTS UNDER VARIOUS RADIATION SOURCES  THIS WILL SUPPORT THE LONG TERM DHS NEEDS AND THE CWMD MISSION SPACE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF DETECTION TECHNOLOGIES TO HELP PREVENT NUCLEAR THREATS BOTH DOMESTICALLY AND ABROAD  ADDITIONALLY, OWING TO THE UNIQUE HIGH TEMPERATURE STABILITY PROPERTIES OF THESE CERAMICS, THIS OPENS NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR LONG TERM SOLID STATE MONITORING TECHNOLOGIES IN HARSH ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS

DETECTING MEV PHOTON ENERGIES AND NEUTRONS GENERALLY RELIES ON SINGLE CRYSTAL DEVICES, WHICH ARE EITHER  A  EXPENSIVE TO MANUFACTURE, B  LIMITED IN SPECTROSCOPIC PERFORMANCE, C  HAVE LIMITED SURVIVABILITY FOR FIELD OPERATIONS, OR D  A COMBINATION OF THE THREE AND ARE THEREFORE PROHIBITIVE TO DEPLOY AS EITHER UBIQUITOUS HAND HELD UNITS OR AS LARGE AREA SINGLE INSTRUMENTS  RECENTLY, POLYCRYSTALLINE SEMICONDUCTORS HAVE GAINED ACADEMIC INTEREST AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO SINGLE CRYSTAL DEVICES DUE TO THEIR SUBSTANTIALLY LOWER MANUFACTURING COSTS AND RELATIVE EASE OF SCALABILITY  HOWEVER, DEVICE PERFORMANCE IS GENERALLY LIMITED TO X RAY PHOTON ENERGY REGIMES DUE TO LARGE RATES OF BULK CHARGE CARRIER RECOMBINATION AT GRAIN BOUNDARIES WHICH SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCES CHARGE COLLECTION EFFICIENCY  IN ADDITION, CURRENT LEADING CANDIDATES FOR NEXT GENERATION ROOM TEMPERATURE DETECTORS, NAMELY METAL HALIDE PEROVSKITES, CURRENTLY SUFFER FROM POOR DEVICE STABILITY DUE TO HIGH IONIC MOBILITY AND LIMITED ENVIRONMENTAL STABILITY  IN ORDER TO ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF DISRUPTIVE ADVANCEMENTS IN POLYCRYSTALLINE MEV PHOTON AND NEUTRON DETECTORS, NEW MATERIALS, MANUFACTURING METHODS, AND DEVICE INTEGRATION STRATEGIES NEED TO BE DEVELOPED THAT  1  LIMIT BULK CHARGE CARRIER RECOMBINATION, 2  REDUCE DETECTOR NOISE, 3  INCREASE ENVIRONMENTALLY STABILITY, 4  UTILIZE SCALABLE MANUFACTURING TECHNIQUES, AND 5  DEMONSTRATE HIGH DETECTION RESOLUTION FOR BOTH DOSE RATE AND SPECTROSCOPY APPLICATIONS THIS PROGRAM AIMS TO REVOLUTIONIZE STATE OF THE ART IONIZING RADIATION DETECTORS BY DEVELOPING WIDE BAND GAP, POLYCRYSTALLINE BASED SEMICONDUCTORS FABRICATED VIA FIELD ASSISTED SINTERING TECHNOLOGY  FAST   NEW MATERIAL SYSTEMS WILL BE EXPLORED VIA FIRST PRINCIPLES DENSITY FUNCTIONAL THEORY  DFT  AND MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES TO IDENTIFY NEW WIDE BAND GAP COMPOUND SEMICONDUCTORS WITH HIGH RADIATION DETECTION SENSITIVITY AND ENVIRONMENTAL STABILITY  THESE NEW MATERIAL SYSTEMS WILL BE SYNTHESIZED AND FABRICATED INTO POLYCRYSTALLINE DETECTORS VIA FAST, A RELATIVELY NEW, SCALABLE MANUFACTURING TECHNIQUE, WHICH CAN CONSOLIDATE SEMICONDUCTING POWDER ON A TIMESCALE OF MINUTES TO SIZES UP TO 14 DIAMETER AND SEVERAL INCHES IN THICKNESS  COMPARED TO COMPETING SINTERING TECHNOLOGIES  I E  CONVENTIONAL SINTERING, HOT ISOSTATIC PRESSING , FAST OFFERS SUBSTANTIALLY SHORTER PROCESS TIMES  MINUTES COMPARED TO HOURS  AND MICROSTRUCTURAL TAILORABILITY ENABLING LOW COST FABRICATION OF LARGE AREA DETECTORS  PROCESSING PARAMETERS WILL BE OPTIMIZED TO ENHANCE MICROSTRUCTURE ATTRIBUTES SUCH AS GRAIN SIZE, TEXTURE AND POROSITY, AS WELL AS TAILORED GRAIN BOUNDARY CHEMISTRY TO REDUCE BULK RECOMBINATION AND ENHANCE CHARGE COLLECTION EFFICIENCY  THIS WILL ENABLE POLYCRYSTALLINE BASED DEVICES TO SPECTROSCOPICALLY DETECT MEV PHOTONS WITH EFFICIENCY THAT RIVALS CURRENT STATE OF THE ART DETECTORS  ADDITIONAL COMPOSITIONAL TAILORING, INCLUDING DOPING STRUCTURES WITH BORON OR LITHIUM, ARE EXPECTED TO ENABLE NEUTRON DETECTION CAPABILITIES  FINALLY, DEVICE ARCHITECTURES WILL BE ENGINEERED FOR SURFACE LEAKAGE SUPPRESSION TO REDUCE NOISE, AND READOUT TECHNOLOGY WILL BE DEVELOPED TO ENHANCE DETECTION SIGNAL FOR APPLICATION INTO PERSONAL DOSIMETERS, DOSE RATE METERS, AND OR SPECTROMETERS  THE PROPOSED PROGRAM AIMS TO ACCOMPLISH THESE RESEARCH GOALS WHILE ALSO PROVIDING MULTIDISCIPLINARY STEM EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO STUDENTS FROM TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS  THIS RESEARCH IS EXPECTED TO HAVE A DRAMATIC IMPACT ON THE CWMD MISSION FOR DETECTING NUCLEAR MATERIALS AS IT WILL ENABLE A NEW CLASS OF POLYCRYSTALLINE BASED DEVICES FOR HIGH ENERGY PHOTON DETECTION AND NEUTRON DETECTION, WHICH OFFER SUBSTANTIALLY LOWER PROCESSING COSTS AND INCREASED SCALABILITY COMPARED TO CURRENT STATE OF THE ART TECHNOLOGIES
